alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern Richmond, northwestern Westmoreland, eastern Caroline, northwestern King William and Essex Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loretto, or 7 miles west of Champlain, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colonial Beach, Montross, Champlain, Saint Stephens Church, Port Royal, Beulahville, Newtown, Newland, Loretto, Leedstown, Beazley, Currioman Landing, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Elevon, Supply, Biscoe, Stratford Hall, Mount Landing and Duane Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
